title: Enable live resume preview and remove Submit-to-Preview flow

requirements.text: Remove the manual “Submit to Preview” interaction from the Resume Editor page UI, including removing the button and updating any helper/instructional text that references submitting to see the preview.

quotes: submit to preview button is not required, once the user fills the information resume preview should be shown automatically
preview update live as the user types, apply to all resume sections, removed completely

acceptanceCriteria: The Resume Editor page no longer renders a "Submit to Preview" button (and no longer imports/uses the Send icon for that control).
The Resume Editor page no longer displays copy telling the user to click submit to see the preview.
No other editor actions require a submit step to make the preview update.

requirements.text: Change the resume preview panel on the Resume Editor page to render the current in-progress resume data live as the user types across all sections (personal info, headline, links, summary, skills, experience, projects, education, certifications).

quotes: submit to preview button is not required, once the user fills the information resume preview should be shown automatically
preview update live as the user types, apply to all resume sections, removed completely

acceptanceCriteria: Typing in any editor input (including repeatable sections like Experience/Education/Projects) updates the preview panel immediately without requiring any button click.
Changing the selected resume font updates the preview panel immediately.

Skills and certifications continue to behave as implemented (local textarea state while typing) while the preview reflects the stored draft data updates (e.g., updates on blur and via keyword insertion).

requirements.text: Update the Full Preview & Download page to display the same live, current resume data that the user is editing (so it matches the editor preview), and ensure PDF download uses that current data.

quotes: once the user fills the information resume preview should be shown automatically
preview update live as the user types, apply to all resume sections, removed completely

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to "/preview" shows the current in-progress resume content (not a stale snapshot requiring submit).
Downloading the PDF reflects the currently displayed preview content.
No manual submit step is required for the "/preview" page to show the latest edits.

requirements.text: Remove or refactor any state/store logic that depends on a separate “submitted resume” snapshot for preview rendering (including the submit-and-reset behavior), so that preview rendering is driven by the draft/in-progress resume data.

quotes: preview update live as the user types

acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer requires calling a submit action to populate preview data.
No code path clears editor data as part of updating preview (since preview is live).
App continues to load persisted resume data and normalization/rehydration logic continues to work without runtime errors.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components) directly; compose them instead.
Do not modify immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Adding new resume templates or changing template rendering/design beyond what is necessary to support live preview.
Backend changes (Motoko canister changes) or storing resumes on-chain.
Adding new authentication providers beyond existing Internet Identity wiring.
